alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Wayne (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 2:51PM MDT until August 17 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN GARFIELD AND SOUTHWESTERN WAYNE COUNTIES... At 251 PM MDT, Capitol Reef National Park rangers reported heavy rainfall producing flash flooding, with Sulphur Creek reaching the Visitor`s Center and the Fremont River overflowing its banks at Fruita Campground. Between 0.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen, with the heaviest totals falling over the Fremont River Basin. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Capitol Reef National Park rangers reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, normally dry washes, and slot canyons. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Capitol Reef National Park, Torrey and Fruita. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
